core:action.core:comment: We'll force online auth for any non-ICC used more than once in the transaciton, regardless of the amounts.

core:executeProcessAction.core:comment: get any previous uses of this card in this transaction for an accurate transaction ceiling check.

core:outcomeLink.core:comment: If configuration allows, try ICC currency when DCC IIN range not found

If configuration specifies, ICC currency overrides DCC currency even when DCC IIN range is found. However, we cannot use this if the availability check includes rate lookup, i.e. it was performed in a single webservice call.

core:executeProcessAction.core:comment: Gets the DCC Rate and sets it on the CardTenderItem if successful. If not will set DCCNotOfferedReason.

core:action.core:comment: Convert the tender amount due in base currency to DCC currency. We use rounding rule up for both tender and refund to be fair and avoid awkward refund situations.

core:outcomeLink.core:comment: If we're doing a refund at original rate it must be from a receipt return. In this case we skip the offer prompt - the refund is forced to be in DCC currency.

core:assignAction.core:comment: Sets the ForeignAmount and TenderAmount fields and teh DCCAccepted flag. The DCCCurrencyId and ExchangeRate fields will already be set but we do not set the tender item CurrencyId itself yet - the currency remains base currency for the purpose of tender limit checks etc.
Finally set the tender item Currency Id itself.

core:outcomeLink.core:comment: Finally if DCC accepted, set the tender item currency id. Note we don't do this until after we've checked limits etc in the normal tender currency.

core:action.core:comment: Test the looked-up DCC Currency is not base currency
Test for possibility of refunding at the prevailing rate

core:outcomeLink.core:comment: If set, allows DCC on Item Returns

core:action.core:comment: Test for possibility of refunding at the original rate

core:outcomeLink.core:comment: Test DCC allowed on Receipt Return

core:assignAction.core:comment: Set ExchangeRate to OriginalRate, set tender amount to amount due, calculate value using original rate and prompt:- "Original currency was {currency}. The amount due is £x.xx. Refund will be in {currency} at {exchangeRate}. Enter the refund amount in {currency}."

core:outcomeLink.core:comment: Skip loading exchnage rate if refund and using original rate

core:assignAction.core:comment: Validate Amount will have set the enetered tender amount on the tender item - copy it back into the process for now.

core:action.core:name: Validate Amount
core:action.core:comment: Converts and validates a previously entered tender amount
And set the Merchant Id appropriate for the Currency
Convert the tender amount due in base currency to DCC currency. We use rounding rule up for both tender and refund to be fair and avoid awkward refund situations.

core:outcomeLink.core:comment: If can't perform selection at PED fall back to operator selection.

core:param.value: Failed to enable DCC Selection at PED
core:param.name: enactor.coreUI.LogMessage

core:action.core:comment: Extract further original DCC tender item properties from the ROTD Tender Amount object.

core:eventLink.core:comment: If we're doing a refund at original rate we have skipped the offer prompt, so if we cancel we must go straight out or we're in a loop.
CardTenderAmount already captured (at contactless up-front amount prompt) and DCC not available. Exit immediately with success.
